item.description:
It's that time of year again, a time where we reflect on our communities and friends.  Instead of running off to the mall to show our appreciation for each other, why don't we all come together and create some memories, by achieving something significant in the board gaming arena: conquering a cooperative game.

Come join Ryan for a night of cooperative strategy gaming.  In this genre, its us vs. the game, where we have to work together using all our wits and talents we can muster to overcome some particularly nefarious challenges.  Make no mistake, these games are hard and beating them would earn us some serious respect.

In Flash Point: Fire Rescue, we are a team of firefighters frantically trying to escort a family out of a burning building.  Navigate the maze carefully and use limited resources to hold back the blaze in a race against time.

In Pandemic, we are the world's brightest doctors and scientists on a mission to discover the cure for plagues that are spreading across civilization.  We must travel across the globe collecting research in various cities until we have the right combination need to stop the disease.

Got a cooperative game?  Bring it!  All are welcome in this joyous celebration of camaraderie. ;-)

Finally, a brief note.  If you are looking to give back this holiday season, Mass General is in need of boardgames that can appeal to an adolescent age group.  So if you have an extra copy of Apples to Apples or Scrabble, please consider donating it.  If you prefer to give back online, please check out the Child's Play Charity.  Thank you.

Hope to see you! :-D

---

Food:

Drinks will be provided.  Please bring additional snacks, drinks or alcohol to share with the group.  I will also be happy to provide a pizza or something, but it all depends on who signs up so I can figure out something common to the dietary needs of everyone.

---

About the location:

This event will be hosted at a private residence, conveniently located at the intersections of Route 1 and Route 95.  If you need directions, just ask.  This is a housing complex, so please do NOT park in any numbered spaces.  There are no animals on the premises and the property should be child-friendly.  Look for Unit 901 since Meetup doesn't display addresses correctly! :-(
